solution_line_template: If the price of a shirt in the store was ${shirt_original_price}, its price was reduced by {discount_percentage_num}/{percent_divisor}*${shirt_original_price}=${<<{shirt_original_price}*{discount_percentage_num}/{percent_divisor}={shirt_discount_amount}>>}{shirt_discount_amount}
The price of a shirt was reduced to ${shirt_original_price}-${shirt_discount_amount}=${<<{shirt_original_price}-{shirt_discount_amount}={shirt_reduced_price}>>}{shirt_reduced_price}
Teagan will pay ${shirt_reduced_price}*{num_shirts}= ${<<{shirt_reduced_price}*{num_shirts}={total_cost_shirts}>>}{total_cost_shirts} for buying {num_shirts} shirts

If the initial price of the leather jacket was ${jacket_original_price}, the price reduced by {discount_percentage_num}/{percent_divisor}*${jacket_original_price}=${<<{jacket_original_price}*{discount_factor}={jacket_discount_amount}>>}{jacket_discount_amount}

The final leather jacket after Mrs. Brynlee reduced the price by 20% is ${jacket_original_price}-${jacket_discount_amount}=${<<{jacket_original_price}-{jacket_discount_amount}={jacket_reduced_price}>>}{jacket_reduced_price}
Teagan will pay ${jacket_reduced_price}*{num_jackets}= ${<<{jacket_reduced_price}*{num_jackets}={total_cost_jackets}>>}{total_cost_jackets} for buying {num_jackets} leather jackets

The amount of money Teagan paid to Mrs. Brynlee for the shirts and the leather jackets is ${total_cost_jackets}+${total_cost_shirts}=${<<{total_cost_jackets}+{total_cost_shirts}={total_money_paid}>>}{total_money_paid}
